Author: yters
Content:
I'll be making a in-game re-programmable MUD at some point.

Neither is awesome in the sense of WoW or any of these other games that are such huge time sinks for so many people. I find that depressing since it implies the useful and the preferable don't match up.

Now if computer games could become equivalent to great art, there'd be hope.

Author: yters
Content: I'm never wrong too, but that's just because I either make trivial, all encompassing, or unfalsifiable claims.  It sounds good though:)

Author: yters
Content: In what way?  Was mimesis about modeling physical appearance or understanding the underlying principles?  I can see how photography is a shortcut for the former, but it seems worse for the latter.

Author: michaelneale
Content: on top of that I don't have a lot of confidence that google won't taketh away should it suit them (they have done so before). Amazon are more clear in that those types of services are the future of their business.

Author: aston
Content: I've been trying it out. Not bad, especially the error highlighting. The only downside is that you have to stop typing to get syntax highlighting.

Author: beforebeta
Content: Have you tried Aptana (http://www.aptana.com/)?. It's a full-fledged Web Development IDE. The JS Editor is especially good and allows for referenced js code lookups from inside html files. It's also available as a regular eclipse add-on.

Author: davidw
Content: How's this different from wikitravel, which has a much larger user base?
